lead_paragraph: Dr. Ali Shroukh’s lifesaving efforts on a West Bank road have been hailed in Israel as inspirational in the face of months of increasing conflict.

byline.contributor: Irit Pazner Garshowitz contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

headline.print_headline: Jewish Settlers, Attacked, Needed Help. A Palestinian Doctor Didn’t Hesitate.
headline.main: Jewish Settlers, Attacked, Needed Help. A Palestinian Doctor Didn’t Hesitate.

snippet: Dr. Ali Shroukh’s lifesaving efforts on a West Bank road have been hailed in Israel as inspirational in the face of months of increasing conflict....
abstract: Palestinian Dr Ali Shroukh, traveling to Jerusalem, helps save lives of Jewish settlers after coming across car that had crashed in West Bank  after Palestinian gunman opened fire on vehicle; Shroukh is flooded with calls from Israeli officials wanting to thank him for his act of kindness, particularly noted in era of conflict in which Palestinian attackers have been unassisted by Israeli medics.
